files.README.md:
# Prompt Shield

Security auditing skill for Claude Code. Detects prompt injection, data exfiltration, supply chain attacks, persistence mechanisms, and hidden malicious content in skills, MCP servers, and npm packages.

## Why

Every skill, MCP server, or npm package you install in Claude Code has access to your working environment: SSH keys, `.env` files, crypto wallets, credentials. A malicious skill hidden behind a clean README can exfiltrate your data using zero-width Unicode, base64-encoded payloads, or invisible tag characters — and you'd never see it.

Prompt Shield automates the security checks that should happen before every install.

## What It Checks

**18 automated checks across 5 categories:**

| Category | Checks |
|----------|--------|
| **A. Hidden Text & Encoding** | Zero-width chars, directional overrides, tag characters, homoglyphs, base64, non-ASCII ratio |
| **B. Prompt Injection** | Direct injection patterns (16 variants), hidden comments, CSS-invisible elements |
| **C. Data Access & Exfiltration** | Credential targeting, crypto wallet paths, network vectors (fetch, curl, nc, socat), IP addresses, data URIs |
| **D. Code Execution & Filesystem** | eval/exec/spawn, inline interpreters (python -c, bash -c), pipe-to-interpreter, path traversal, obfuscation, env access |
| **E. Persistence & Background** | crontab, launchd, systemd, nohup, daemon/fork, pm2, screen/tmux |

**Plus:**
- Full file inventory with size flagging (>100KB)
- URL inventory with suspicious domain detection (pastebin, ngrok, webhook.site, etc.)
- Long URL detection (>200 chars, potential encoded payloads)
- Cross-correlation: files with BOTH sensitive data AND network access = CRITICAL

## Full Audit Workflow (8 Steps)

1. **Identify target type** (Skill / MCP Server / npm Package)
2. **Author verification** (GitHub profile, account age, commit history, contributor count, repo issues)
3. **Enumerate and read ALL files** (every file, no exceptions)
4. **Analyze plugin.json / package.json** (lifecycle scripts, non-standard fields)
5. **Run automated scan** (18 checks via `scan_files.sh`)
6. **Verify ALL URLs** (domain legitimacy, encoded parameters)
7. **Manual deep review** (verify alerts in context, cross-correlation, YAML frontmatter)
8. **Generate structured report** (author trust score, risk level, verdict)

## Install

```bash
claude plugin marketplace add frenchieTST/prompt-shield
claude plugin install prompt-shield
```

## Usage

Once installed, Prompt Shield activates automatically when you:
- Ask Claude to audit a skill, MCP server, or npm package
- Say "is this safe", "check security", "scan for threats", or "prompt injection check"
- Install any new skill or plugin

You can also invoke it directly:
```
Audit the skill at https://github.com/user/repo
```

## File Structure

```
prompt-shield/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json                   # Plugin manifest
├── README.md
└── skills/
    └── prompt-shield/
        ├── SKILL.md                  # Main audit workflow (8 steps)
        ├── scripts/
        │   └── scan_files.sh         # Automated scanner (18 checks)
        └── references/
            ├── audit-checklist.md    # Detailed checklists per audit type
            ├── threat-patterns.md    # Threat pattern reference (7 categories)
            └── npm-supply-chain.md   # npm-specific supply chain checks
```

## Scanner Output Example

```

================================================

[ 4/18] Homoglyph characters......... CLEAN
[ 5/18] Base64 encoded content....... CLEAN
[ 6/18] Non-ASCII byte analysis...... CLEAN

--- B. Prompt Injection ---
[ 7/18] Prompt injection patterns..... CLEAN

--- C. Data Access & Exfiltration ---
[ 9/18] Sensitive data access......... CLEAN
[10/18] Crypto wallet targeting....... CLEAN
[11/18] Network/exfiltration vectors.. REVIEW
[12/18] Hardcoded IP addresses........ CLEAN
[13/18] Data URI schemes.............. CLEAN

--- D. Code Execution & Filesystem ---
[14/18] Dynamic code execution........ CLEAN
[15/18] Filesystem path traversal..... CLEAN
[16/18] Obfuscation & env access...... CLEAN

--- E. Persistence & Background Processes ---
[17/18] Persistence mechanisms........ CLEAN
[18/18] Background process spawning... CLEAN

================================================
  Result: 1 ISSUE(S) FOUND across 18 checks
```

## Severity Levels

| Level | Meaning | Action |
|-------|---------|--------|
| CLEAN | No issues | Proceed |
| REVIEW | Needs manual check | Verify in context, likely benign |
| ALERT | Probable threat | Investigate thoroughly |
| CRITICAL | Confirmed threat | Do not install |
